data.title: Famous People From Sunderland, England & Celebs Born In Sunderland
data.meta_description: Sunderland has produced a number of famous personalities, including reality tv personalities, pop singers, football players, pop musicians, surgeons etc.

Gina McKee

(Best Known for Her Roles in the TV Series: ‘Our Friends in the North’ and ‘The Lost Prince’)

25

15

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: April 14, 1964

Sun Sign: Aries

Georgina McKee grew up to be a self-taught actor, after being rejected by major acting schools such as LAMDA. Her role as Mary Cox in Our Friends in the North earned her a BAFTA. Fans also loved her in the series The Lost Prince and the film Notting Hill.

3

Courtney Hadwin

(Singer-Songwriter Known for Her Appearances in ‘The Voice Kids UK 2017 ‘ and ‘America's Got Talent’)

823

59

Listed In: Singers

Birthdate: July 6, 2004

Sun Sign: Cancer

Courtney Hadwin is an English singer-songwriter who achieved popularity by participating in the first series of ITV's The Voice Kids and the 13th season of NBC's America's Got Talent, where she was a finalist. She is one of the youngest artists to sign a record deal with Arista Records and Syco Entertainment.

Charlotte Crosby

(Television Personality Known for Her Reality Series ‘Geordie Shore’ and ‘Celebrity Big Brother’)

10

6

Listed In: Film & Theater Personalities

Birthdate: May 17, 1990

Sun Sign: Taurus

Charlotte Crosby is an English TV personality best known for winning the 12th series of Celebrity Big Brother. Just before joining college, she successfully auditioned to appear in the reality series Geordie Shore. She was featured in 12 series of the show before she quit. She went on to star in her own MTV reality series, The Charlotte Show.

Dave Stewart

(British Musician, Record Producer, and Songwriter)

8

3

Listed In: Musicians

Birthdate: September 9, 1952

Sun Sign: Virgo

David A. Stewart is a British musician, record producer, and songwriter. He is best known for forming a pop duo named Eurythmics along with singer-songwriter Annie Lennox. The band became highly successful, earning Stewart and Lennox several awards. The duo was inducted into the Songwriters Hall of Fame and Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 2020 and 2022 respectively.

Joseph Swan

(Chemist, Physicist, Inventor)

3

1

Listed In: Scientists

Birthdate: October 31, 1828

Sun Sign: Scorpio

Died: May 27, 1914

Joseph Swan was an English chemist, physicist, and inventor known for being an independent early developer of a successful incandescent light bulb. He developed and supplied the first batch of incandescent lights used for illuminating houses and public buildings. He was elected a Fellow of the Royal Society (FRS) in 1894 and knighted by King Edward VII in 1904.

Graham Wallas

(British Psychologist, Sociologists and Political Scientist)

1

0

Listed In: Physicians

Birthdate: May 31, 1858

Sun Sign: Gemini

Died: August 9, 1932

Political scientist and Fabian Society leader Graham Wallas is best known for his iconic work Human Nature in Politics. He contributed to the development of the London School of Economics and was one of its first professors. He also proposed one of the first models of the creative process.
